alert.note: Alert for Mercer (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 8:21AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and southeast West Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Giles. In southeast West Virginia, Mercer. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...It will take several hours for all the water from earlier overnight excessive rainfall to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 819 AM EDT, Minor flooding continues along the East River at Willowton or near Glen Lyn. At 800 AM EDT, the East River at Willowton was at the flood stage of 9.0 feet and slowly falling. The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Glen Lyn and Willowton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
